title: Konstantine Kupatadze
text:
Konstantine Kupatadze () (born 28 April 1983) is a <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> from <a href="Georgia%20%28country%29">Georgia</a>.
He participated in the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%202004%20Summer%20Olympics">2004 Summer Olympics</a>. There he was stopped in the second round of the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%202004%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Featherweight">featherweight (57 kg)</a> division by North Korea's eventual runner-up <a href="Kim%20Song-Guk">Kim Song-Guk</a>.
Kupatadze won bronze medals in the same division at the <a href="2002%20European%20Amateur%20Boxing%20Championships">2002 European Amateur Boxing Championships</a> and the <a href="2004%20European%20Amateur%20Boxing%20Championships">2004 European Amateur Boxing Championships</a>.
